column1: -:- Message from Tripadvisor staff -:-This post has been removed at the author's request. The author may repost if desired.Posts on the Tripadvisor forums may be edited for a short period of time. Once the edit period has expired, authors may update their posts by removing and reposting them.To read more about editing your posts, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/help/how_to_edit_your_postsRemoved on: 8:59 am, March 25, 2020
Oh boy, you just can't help some ppl.For goodness sake, delete your post OP.We are not Travelgenio and can't do anything for your problem with the shonky booking agent you used.
File a complaint with your credit card provider. See if they can help you get your money back.
I'm not sure- HAS anyone else had a problem with Travelgenio? Have you checked?
Skim this board. You gave your money to possibly the worst company out there.Did you do any research before you chose them?

I have the same issue with Travelgenio. I've sent them multiple emails for ore than a month now. Unfortunately, I never receive a reply. I disputed the charge from my bank but they needed a void memo for the amount to be reimbursed. Travelgenio is the worst! they can't even provide me with the void memo.Edited: 2:12 am, March 25, 2020
>>> has anyone else had a similar expenence with travelgenio <<<Hundreds. You could all get together and have a worldwide convention. Organise your own flights though.
The notice was confirmed. But we are past the scheduled date of our trip. I hope you can settle this reservation quickly.
It’s great to see that travelers are communicating with Travelgenio via Trip Advisor. Seems to be working. Very innovative.
Well, there you go.The bot has spoken, and all is right with the world.Best of luck,Hunt

HEEGYEONG KIM if you have sent your petition as asked in the link provided it has been registered and will be replied as soon as we have all the details. Take into account that, due to the amount of petitions received, we are priorizing and some queries need also the info and management of airlines. It can take some time to have all the details. Regardss
Posting you experience just the once is enough Talia..

-:- Message from Tripadvisor staff -:-Tripadvisor staff removed this post at the original author's request.To review the Tripadvisor Forums Posting Guidelines, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/pages/forums_posting_guidelines.htmlWe remove posts that do not follow our posting guidelines, and we reserve the right to remove any post for any reason.Removed on: 9:05 pm, April 06, 2020
Can you see it on every thread I’ve put it on? Can’t say I’m a tripadvisor expert, just wanted to give people a bit of hope that’s all
No, Talia, nobody can see your multiple posts because all but one have been removed.That's what happens when you post the same thing on lots of threads.
In fact, it could be considered fortunate that they all haven't disappeared.It's a learning curve for new contributors, but posting once really is enough.
